result.execSummary:
The defendant Valerie T Kolen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.

Signed and filed. Copies mailed to parties.
Court orders: The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. jbs

Defendant Valerie T Kolen in court with attorney Gary George.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Protasiewicz, who has recused herself.
 DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 3 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Agent to contact the court if another review hearing is necessary.

Defendant Valeria T Kolen in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State complied with victim notification. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim Leon Y.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay the DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Valerie T Kolen in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
.
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court withheld the sentence and ordered the defendant to complete a Batterer's Intervention Program for victims of domestic abuse and come an AODA assessment.  Court ordered case adjourned for review.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Review hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
